page.title: 03THE CHURCH IN COLYTON
page.content: St.Andrews Church,the main place of worship, is in the middle of Colyton. This is the Anglican Parish Church. The present vicar is Rev.Harry Rann. There is a Methodist Church at the top of King Street, built in 1814 as a Congregational Chapel. It was enlarged in 1831. There is a Gospel Hall in West Street (the Butts). There is another small chapel in the cemetery, on New Sidmouth Road. There used to be a Unitarian Chapel in Church Street; this was closed years ago and is now used as a youth club.An interesting fact is that at one time the minister there was Dr.Manton, one of Cromwell's chaplains. The Revd. J B Smith, a minor poet, was also minister there.
